issue.title: [CF 457] Text Output -> Binding/Label Text
issue.body:
I have come across a situation where it would be nice to be able to change the Binding/Label Text of the current(or another) icon via a event.

For my example I would like the Label Text on my Wild Mushroom: Detonate to be the current number of active Wild Mushrooms I have.

The way I see setting this up is to have a hidden icon update the text whenever I cast Wild Mushroom. The input would need some way to evaluate some LUA so that the below can be used to grab the number of active Wild Mushrooms.

``` local count=0;for i=1,3 do if select(1,GetTotemInfo(i)) then count=count+1; end; end ```

Another solution to this would be to add a way to evaluate LUA in the existing Binding/Label Text input, however, I'm not sure how often values here are already updated. An option for when to re-evaluate it might be needed with this solution.

In case your wondering why, I don't use the default UI so the bar that normally shows your active mushrooms isn't visible, and I think I'd much rather just have a number that shows the count then the actual bar anyways. I imagine it would be possible to do what I want already, but it would require an icon for each number of mushrooms which is a bit much for a small thing like this.


> Posted by CurseForge user pvtschlag | Imported from CurseForge issue #457 | Raw

comments.body:
I have been playing around with the idea of using LibDogTag-3.0 for text overlays on icons, which would make this, and many, many other things possible. I think that it is going to be almost required for me to be able to implement bars as an alternative to icons, too.

Edited Mar 2, 2012
